reviews.text: Good range of books and an ambience to indulge in thumbing the eye catching titles, with a good spread of gadgetry and toys. Surprising to see decline in the range offered in diaries and calendars while a rise in generic stationary items. Highly trending in non fiction titles is another aspect of 2019 at landmark books arena.. Very encouraging changes in layout of stores, so that one feels like spending time there.

One of the best places to go to if you're a person who just loves spending your time amongst books. They have the perfect collection of books.. books of all categories.. also a comic book haven for comic book fans. They have a dedicated section when people can read books too. 
Apart from books, they have a wide collection of toys for children as well as action figures for collectibles and enthusiasts. 
Fashion accessories, unique forms of diaries, office supplies, bags, mugs, and chocolates are some of the other things that can be found here.

I had been to Landmark which is in Forum, it has developed over a timeframe as far as inside and quality also. Milestone is one stop arrangement on the off chance that you are a book significant other. You have all the assortment of books running from anecdotal, magazines, recorded, instructive and so forth. They have great assortment of books for children too, I like the flawless story books for them.

The games activity is likewise great and contains all the fundamental necessities for all the game. We had purchased a cycle from that point, the conveyance for which was entirely quick. A dazzling spot for book significant others.

Nice place to find books..... And you also get cute stuffs... Not to mention the toy section.... Oh boy!!! .... Doesn't matter how old I get, I will always go in there to check out those cute stuffed toys and marvel avenger figures!!

The shop is good. The collection of books and games is good ( online price is much cheaper). But the staff is untrained. They asked me debit card pin stating ATM machine under charging instead of asking cash as alternative. They did not serviced me to another queue for payment. The payment processing takes more than 30 minutes in queue. Very slow staff.
Shopping mall and Hotel ( Novotel).  Very convenient, location, good restaurants also. Three is a train(subway) station, so you can easy get to airport o any other part of peninsula or island.

What a fantastic little hidden gem. The store is beautiful and the experience provided by the sales staff especially, Lana was fantastic. From the moment I walked in she was very welcoming and attentive. Her knowledge of the products and her advice was exceptional. She made the process of finding a style and colour to suit me very easy. She has wonderful customer service and I would highly recommend the store and Lana for the purchase of your next special gown.

Far from being an outlet.
Prices are high, old fashion, old collections. 
Don't waste your time here.
Great shopping mall to enjoy the restaurants around here and one thing to note is that there's a hotel here as well. This place is a good stopover since it is near the MTR (subway) station as well.

A seriously good collection of discounted brand names although I've come to realize these discounts are now nowhere near as good as they were 2-3 years ago. Who's kidding who? The influx of mainland Chinese on buying trips has caused a disproportionate rise in store prices. This is no longer a shoppers paradise like it was in 2013-2017!! I've bought may items here over the years from many different stores but I've found princess today are not as discounted from outside prices as the stores say they are. Greed has crept back in at Citygate. Local code shops and restaurants are still ok.

It is an almost exact replica of the Cenotaph in Whitehall, London, which was designed by Sir Edwin Lutyens and unveiled in 1920, two years after the end of the First World War. The Cenotaph was unveiled in 1923 to commemorate the dead of the First World War. Initially, it was simply inscribed with the words “The Glorious Dead.” The dates 1939-1945 were later added to honour victims of the Second World War. In the 1970s, eight Chinese characters 英魂不朽浩氣長存, meaning “May their martyred souls be immortal, and their noble spirits endure,” were carved on the side of the Cenotaph as a belated recognition of those who lost their lives during the Japanese invasion.
Here stands a solemn monument to remember the supreme sacrifice made by the servicemen during WW1 (1914-1918) and WW2 (1939-1945). Salute!
A place to remember
Awesome view arnd....

The Cenotaph (Traditional Chinese: 和平紀念碑) is a war memorial, constructed in 1923 and located between Statue Square and the City Hall in Central, Hong Kong,that commemorates the dead in the two world wars who served in Hong Kong in the Royal Navy, British Army and Royal Air Force. Built in stone, it is an almost exact replica of the Cenotaph on Whitehall in London, UK(designed by Sir Edwin Lutyens and unveiled in 1920).It is listed as a monument under the Antiquities and Monuments Ordinance.

A very old beautiful Chinese temple where locals come to pray. Lots of Incense inside, need to be careful if you are allergic. Otherwise very peaceful and  Photography is allowed. Enjoy Hollywood street once outside with lots of Antique stuff.

That's a Buddhist temple from XIX century in the middle of hill on main island of Hiking Kong. It's free entrance and easy to go by those sequence of sleeper escalators. Its facades are simple but inside is such a beautiful and cozy place to connect to spirituality just into the busy city. The interior design is incredibly rich of details with great job in wood and very colourful. The smell, the foggy atmosphere and the sound make us feel serenity and calm...I just loved to visit that place. After visit the temple take the way on your left and walk for that area where you will find many antiquity stores, Asian objects and furniture.

Popular temple for both tourists and locals. The temple is primarily focused on work and study so often times during the new year you'll see many locals lining up to say their prayers and receive luck for the the new year in either their work or study endeavours. 

Note: If your eyes are really sensitive it might not be best to be here for very long as the whole temple is full of incense and smoke and can easily irritate the eyes.

Beautiful, and definitely worth a visit! Just be prepared for lots of incense smoke. People are actually praying in here although they still accept photography just be respectful. My partner personally felt very uncomfortable with this element. There weren't too many signs in English either so just be prepared to read about it on your phone while in there if you want some context.
Beautiful temple in the heart of central. A must visit. It is a temple still used for religious purposes so be respectful when you visit.

Brilliant free museum in a beautiful historical building once lived in by the storied Ho-Tung family. (It was later used as a Mormon church, as evidenced by the baptismal font and vault still present on the ground floor). The mansion was built in 1914 in a mixed British-Chinese colonial style. The permanent exhibition on Dr. Sun Yat-sen covers a few floors and gives a thorough look at the founding father of modern China and perhaps one of the most interesting figures to ever live. While not the focus of the exhibition, it also sheds light on Hong Kong's historical position as a political safe haven for great Asian revolutionaries and thinkers.
Must go to know more about Dr Sun's historic trial.  The building (Kom Tong Hall) itself is a magnificent legacy.
Free and informative museum. A lovely stop amongst the steep narrow streets around central / mid levels.
It was a raining day. Not so many people. A good place to see some history and relax.

The Dr. Sun Yat Sen Museum (free entry) is located on Castle Road at the top of the steep Aberdeen Street. The museum is housed in the restored Kom Tong Hall, a four-storey Declared Monument. Opening hours are 10am to 6pm daily (closed on Thursday) 

Architecturally, this is a nice building to view. It was constructed in 1914 and is Neo-classical with red brick walls. The interior offers hints of Baroque and Rococo which you will see throughout. Do enjoy the grand staircase. It is particularly impressive. 

The museum includes three floors of exhibition space detailing the life of Dr. Sun Yat Sen, who spent much time here Hong Kong. You will learn about his early life and introduction to politics, his revolution against the Qing Dynasty and founding of the Republic of China. For this, Dr. Sun Yet Sen goes down in history as the Father of the Republic of China. 

The exhibition includes artefacts, audiovisual programming and general information. It feels rather detailed at times but you can go through galleries at your own pace. As such, this is a place you could spend half an hour if you've limited time or perhaps a couple of hours if you are particularly interested in this historically important figure in this region of the world. 

Note: There is a statue of Dr. Sun Yat Sen in the courtyard outside the Kom Tung Hall mansion. It is worth a quick look-see before or after visiting the museum.
Herausragendes Galerieprogramm, kompetente und sympatische Beratung. Der Besuch lohnt sich.

A beautiful and historical building at the top of HK Park. Friendly n helpful staff. Free short (~20 mins) Art/ architecture or the like movies at lunch time every day. No reservation needed for lunch time movies.

There's a small gallery at the entrance of the building. There doesn't seem to be any permanent exhibition. What you see is mainly work from students. Other than the gallery you won't find anything else to see. This is mainly a learning institution. They will let you walk around and admire the architecture. If I were you I would skip this stop. Instead look at the other attractions in the park like The Tea Ware Museum, the Aviary or the Greenhouse.

Small but nice free temporary exhibition. Nothing special, but it's open for everyone and free. Close to beautiful park, so it's nice to visit it.
This time was small maze with different art. Maybe next time will be something other and also interesting.
I think it's not worth to go to see only this place, but when we will connected it with HK Park or with Pick Tram it's ok.
It is awesome place to see and know art..

We pass by the Hong Kong Visual Arts Centre from time to time and enjoy viewing  the exhibition hall which is used to showcase works of local artists and other interesting exhibitions throughout the year. 

The exhibition space is quite small, just 3 rooms so you can visit comfortably in 15-30 minutes. It is air-conditioned inside as well, making this a nice place to escape the heat if you are visiting Hong Kong Park during the summer time.

You can have a look at the Hong Kong Visual Arts Centre website to see what is presently being exhibited. Unfortunately, it is not alway up to date so you might happen upon something a bit unexpected like we did with the 'Children's Dream' exhibition we saw recently.
This was a very fun experience. It was really big and lots of superstars were there. I would  highly recommend taking a camera with you because you can take beautiful photos. 🤳

Madame Tussauds Amsterdam is the cool place to visit. It's very well organized. They also have captain marvel theme for kids and for the Marvel fans. They have nice art work and statue of lot of famous celebrity from film industry, music industry , sports industry. It was nice visit.
Great place. Worth a visit. Expensive but I guess it is not cheap to make and perhaps even royalties paid for the characters and figures. Children loved it too.

Had a lot of fun in this place. We went in January and it was mostly empty which was nice. Lots of interactive displays and cool things to look at. It was better than I expected. Go during off hours; I could see this place not being nearly as good if it were crowded.

Fun! Most of the wax figures look quite young so might need to be updated at some point. First Madame Tussauds I've been to. Sent a photo of me with Ryan Gosling to a friend and found out by chance she was in Amsterdam too so that was a wonderful surprise 😂
You will find fine Chinese art and western art exhibitions
A small but nice museum with a couple of exhibits. It was free to go in.
What they had was Great but over all a disappointing experience with most of the exhibits closed

SmallMuseum with free entry.
There is a permanent exhibit of Chinese artifacts.  Check their website to see what they are showing as their temporary exhibit.  They very will often bring in interesting collections to show.

The University of Hong Kong is home to the University Museum and Art Gallery, housed in the Fung Ping Shan Building at 94 Bonham Road. Hong Kong's oldest museum, it is renowned for its collection of bronzes and ceramics. 

There are three main periods of bronzes represented by the various items: vessels from the Shang and Zhou Dynasty; mirrors from the Warring States period; and crosses from the Yuan Dynasty. 

The ceramics collection includes Han Dynasty funerary urns as well as more recent works from other parts of China
It has moved into the peak centre during the renovations in the other building- on the 2nd upper most level. They don't seem to have as many backgrounds but it was good fun.
Amazing place to visit at top of Hong Kong. Nice location and nice experience of having nice photos.
We had such a laugh there. Very hot n humid but fun
I went to the Peak today, I must CLARIFY here, Trick Eye Museum in HK is permanently closed for long time. I confirmed this info from the reception of the Peak.
Fun place, the kid enjoyed all kinds of funny photos

The park was well maintained and clean. It is so refreshing to visit the place after days of seeing buildings and buildings in Hong Kong. The park is situated just right behind a huge mall. Very nice concept done by the govt of Hong Kong of keeping this park considering that space is luxury in this country. A must visit. And the best part. Its free. You just have to be a responsible tourist by not throwing any garbage anywhere.

It's l a gorgeous and maintained Park in the middle of the city. It has wonderful views and plant life. The free aviary is especially a big hit! With tons wild birds. The people that gathered here are very friendly and courteous. Needless to say I was very impressed with the entire park despite a fair mount of construction going on. I would definitely come again.

The park makes great use of its limited space with a variety of garden styles. The stream with redheaded to to is is a great draw and there is a variety of water birds where the stream pools. There is a section of this stream which flows over wide steps and a fountain flowing from a canopy with a gap so you can stand in the centre of it. There's a good Thai restaurant with outdoor seating or indoor tables in an air--conditioned room for summer. Best of all is the walk through aviary. It feels like walking through the rainforest.

What a treasure in the middle of Hong Kong! Peaceful,  serene,  attractive,  varied... well worth a visit. It has a lovely conservatory area with exotic plants and another section of birds etc. Pleasant fountain on the grounds. And an arena commemorating the 2008 bejing Olympics. We really enjoyed spending an hour there

We went there for the aviary for the first time and it was a lovely experience. The Bali Starling came close and posed for photos. The other birds were equally photogenic. The place is disinfected frequently and very clean. Best of all, admission is free of charge. Highly recommended.

Nice hiking trails easily accessible by bus or a long walk from the subway.

The historic battery was really cool and had good signage (with English) to learn about the history. 

The trail up to the battery has a beautiful, dense bamboo forest and many birds. Unfortunately we did not find any great views since the brush has grown too tall.
Very pleasant family hiking trail. Has a historical site too. An artillery battery site built since 1920s.

On some of the lesser traveled does, there are some breathtaking views to be had. Don't always trust the hiking maps, as trails are intermittently closed, and many of the smaller trails have been rendered inaccessible by the installation of a landslide rock protection fence. Still, it's possible to hike from here to The Peak.
A convenient place to take a walk in Hong Kong island.
A good place for hiking.
Best dumplings I’ve ever had anywhere! And the owner is always so happy and friendly to everyone.. What a find!

A great choice for something quick and healthy in central!
 
I love coming here for quick breakfasts and lunches. Not only are the dumplings delicious, but they are healthy as well! A lot of times when you think of “healthy food” it’s often something cold. But dumplings are a great warm alternative!

Moreover, this place offers a lot of dumplings options that are rare to find elsewhere. The menu differs everyday of the week so it’s fun to try something different from time to time

When I come here for breakfasts, I can see the ladies here wrapping the dumplings themselves, giving this place a warm and homey vibe (moreover you can tell that the dumplings are all made in-house)!

This is my go-to for quick breakfasts and lunches and everyone that I’ve brought here loves this place too!
Fried dumpling is like Korean style. We call it twi-gim-man-du
Nice dumplings with reasonable price.
Diculous home made dumplings

More like a 3.5. The food was okay but a bit pricy although it is Central. Some pieces of my beef brisket were a bit hard. A bit salty. English menu upon request and staff understands some English. Fast service.
Congee with fish slice is so good, little bit ginger in it. Also braised noodle with sweet and hot sliced pork is good as well. They’re serving noodles after 11am.

Really normal but OK price for central. Don't understand the popularity of this place. Maybe I didn't choice the right meal choice though. I choose vegetables with Noodle for 37 hkd. The taste was OK, and too salty.
Great Chinese style congee and noodles at very affordable price
When you come to this restaurant, try their congee, dumplings and mustard fish balls. good quality. But the wonton is too small and not delicious.
Tasted their ice creams in the HK sevens. The chocolate was very good, full of dark chocolate flavour. The sea salted caramella didn’t have much flavour, it was like a light cream.
One of my favorite ice cream shops in town. Really yummy, and they serve generous portions. The salted caramel taste is really special
Good place for Ice creams
We had the Nutella and it was very creamy and flavorful. Bummed they didn’t have the Hong Kong milk tea flavor when we went though.
Yummy!

The park was well maintained and clean. It is so refreshing to visit the place after days of seeing buildings and buildings in Hong Kong. The park is situated just right behind a huge mall. Very nice concept done by the govt of Hong Kong of keeping this park considering that space is luxury in this country. A must visit. And the best part. Its free. You just have to be a responsible tourist by not throwing any garbage anywhere.

The people that gathered here are very friendly and courteous. Needless to say I was very impressed with the entire park despite a fair mount of construction going on. I would definitely come again.

The park makes great use of its limited space with a variety of garden styles. The stream with redheaded to to is is a great draw and there is a variety of water birds where the stream pools. There is a section of this stream which flows over wide steps and a fountain flowing from a canopy with a gap so you can stand in the centre of it. There's a good Thai restaurant with outdoor seating or indoor tables in an air--conditioned room for summer. Best of all is the walk through aviary. It feels like walking through the rainforest.

It has a lovely conservatory area with exotic plants and another section of birds etc. Pleasant fountain on the grounds. And an arena commemorating the 2008 bejing Olympics. We really enjoyed spending an hour there

We went there for the aviary for the first time and it was a lovely experience. The Bali Starling came close and posed for photos. The other birds were equally photogenic. The place is disinfected frequently and very clean. Best of all, admission is free of charge. Highly recommended.
Very nice staff and the food was excellent. Didn't take long to arrive and was hot and fresh. Pretty consistent ordering at Pizza Express. There is a takeaway option also if you need to dash.
Very good pizza. Perfect service. I will come back for sure ;).
Such good food! At first it looks like a fast food restaurant but the food is really good quality and tasty!
Good pizza, slow service.
Delicious food. Friendly, helpful staff.

Tables are pretty close to one another so there is little to no privacy for a business chat. Portions are decent, size wise and taste wise. Staff is polite and speaks good English. Drinks could be colder and specials could be priced better. It's a decent Japanese place but nothing special.
Great Japanese place in Central HK. It’s actually hard to find and hence i have taken a photo from the outside to help you find it. You won’t be disappointed. I will be back !
Excellent food and fantastic service! We had the rock shrimp salad, the soft shell crab plate, and the Deluxe Lunch Set; all were fresh and delicious, and came in big portions!
Fabulous Japanese food. Highly recommend the coconut sorbet for dessert and the warm sake apart from all the usual good stuff

Very nice service and support good food. 
If you like good sushi is one of the best I find in the city so really recommend. 
Price is ok for what you get!

Disappointment.  The menu looked great online and on the window but when my wife and I sat down we were handed a stained paper menu with about 6 salads and 6 entrees.  My choice wasn't on the list and had to try the "leg" of lamb.  It turned out to be a dry, recooked lamb steak with little flavor.  My wife's gnocci was bland except for the excessive use of garlic.  If they spent half the time working on making the food better as they do designing the plate it might be edible.  DO NOT GO!
Excellent Italian food. The bruschetta was the best I have ever had, and the sauce over the sweet potato gnocchi was great. One of my top three restaurants in Cville
I liked the food.
service is non existent
Nice as always. Good to go especially during happy hour! A quiet and cozy place that you can chill with your friend all day long.

Cute little place and easy to find. Food was ok. I had the scrambled eggs with mushrooms and onions. The onions wasn’t cooked through and would’ve been nice if it was caramelised. I guess I’m just used to Melbourne breakfast. Otherwise, it’s well priced but I expected more.
We were seeking a Western style breakfast and went out of our way to find this place. The menu was pretty decent and prices affordable. Just a word of warning, it’s located up a pretty steep road.
super cute breakfast spot with good grub
Food was amazing, didn’t take too long, decent pricing, friendly staff.
I love this place. Food is good to satisfy the cravings. Comfortable environment and setting. Excellent service. Will want to go back to try their lunch buffets.

Good, high quality Indian cuisine with a great set of variations when it comes to the food. Nice interiors as well with the cosier, slightly upscale touches of dark wood and dim light for the dinner service. Service overall is attentive and handles both small parties and larger groups well.

Had a delicious early dinner here. Lovely dining atmosphere. We had the butter chicken, paneer, and some pulled chicken dish and a mix bread basket with roti and banana varieties. Everything tasted delicious. I also enjoyed my fresh watermelon juice. Would totally come again and again. Love it here.

Brilliant restaurant, the ambiance is great, sseating is comfy and personal. The staff and service are both excellent. The food is consistently excellent. I especially recommend the lunch time buffet.

The few times I visited this place they had, in addition to standard North Indian food, also a great selection of Coastal and Southern Indian food. Since usually South Indian restaurants tend to be vegetarian, I like this place. I could get my fill of fish curries etc. Now that is no longer an option. They have scuttled all non standard fare. So everything is the usual Indian restaurant food. Which is not bad, if that's what you want. But restaurants that serve these dishes are many in HK. So for me the draw to Jashan has ended. Food is still excellent. And the place is clean, prices are pretty standard.
Oolaa has great did options and friendly staff. Brunch is a great time to go and enjoy the open space. Good Bloody Mary and tasty Mimosas. Good value. Will go again.

I really enjoyed  the light/healthy breakfast I had but if you're in the mood for something a little more lavish they have you covered in that department as well. Indoor and outdoor seating, nice staff, great ambiance.

Additionally the smoothies here are a cure-all for any grogginess or nausea you might be feeling (especially following a night of gluttonous eating and/or unhindered drinking).
Serving international cuisine, popular with foreigners and suitable for large groups. Healthy menu options and nice quality food.

Love love this place for its food. For its ambience,  the space and the variety of seating arrangements ! Great western food and coffee above all , fresh and healthy. Awesome location too , next to PMQ

Opens up on to a quiet street with very little traffic. So it has a nice outdoors feel. And the food is pretty darn good too! Great options to soak up an excess of booze the night before. And good healthy choices if you're that way inclined. Generous portions too

A restaurant located in a heritage building on the top of the peak. You can not only enjoy the foods but the scenic view of the Victoria Harbor. It is very relaxing to have meal sitting outdoor. The food is acceptable.

Run from the horrible Peak mall teaming with  tourists and tat and relax into a civilized dining experience here. Amazing views and friendly staff. Food and drink, although on the pricey side, is fresh and delicious. See my pic of the rice and pineapple dish.  Was too much for the BF to finish!
The best restaurant in the Victoria Peak. The environment is nice and comfortable. The foods are good too. Price is reasonable in regard to it location. Indoor and outdoor seats are lovely.
Don't be misled by the tatty looking front. Once you've got inside the experience changes completely. Very romantic interior, great food, reasonable prices, excellent service. Highly recommend.
Cool and windy lookout towards the brightly lighted Hong Kong City!
Pleasant french bistro, good kitchen and nice selection of wines. The lunch menu is always delightful.
The best steak I've had in my life (hanger) plus centurion discount!
Perfect lunch place. Great steak.
Classic well executed French food and wine.
I only had a light dinner. Escargot were spot on and the Lyonnais salad was perfect. Nice selection is wine's by the glass as well.

Considering that most Chinese places have few vegetarian options, chilli fagara was a pleasant surprise. The veg dumplings and the fried tofu dishes were especially delicious, very well-made & flavoursome. Potato noodles that we tried were not our cup of tea but then the dessert was awesome. It proved that this place is deserving of it's 'Michelin guided' status. Highly recommended!!
The food was good. The service which never used to be its strong point, has now improved dramatically. Very pleased with the dinner tonight.
Great place to eat if u love chilli from dumpling to fried rice lovers the meals have different types of chilli and it’s a great choice

Great atmosphere and great tastes. Crews are kind. Doesn't have a looooot of seats so recommend to make a reservations. Spicy foods are famous. Chicken, shrimp, porks. Everything was good. Price is high.
Amazing Sichuan food. The Dan Dan Mein is some of the best I've had in the city

We came for dinner and it was excellent. 
We made reservations and we were not disappointed. It was so incredibly good and we are so full! You will not be dissatisfied in the meal or service! Be sure to make a reservation because this place gets easily crowded especially on weekends!
Best waiters ever! Full of historical facts about movie stars that have dined there. Food was phenomenal.  Bella 🤩
Food was great.   Bar tender was conversational and polite
The food is good and tasty! Had the red sauce pasta with shrimp and my sister got the chicken fettuccine, they use such big plate that makes the portion so little. Dessert was good too.
Best steak in town really enjoyed atmosphere service was great should make reservations
Central Plaza Chiang Rai is the best shopping mall in the city and the entire province. The food court on the lowest floor also has very good Northern Thai food.

I came here looking for the AIS telephone shop. Found it very quickly the people were super nice and got my business done in a timely fashion. It's a very comfortable Mall only two floors so it's not packed with stuff.

It's a mall, which you could expect to find everything; food, cloth, grocery, gadget, cinema etc. Ranging from the cheap to the affordable brand name ones, Central Plaza Chiang Rai is the solution for whom looking for the all-in-one shopping place. There are also various kinds of taxi service. But beware! the price can be bargain.

Great little mall with movie theater. They offer a free shuttle to and from town as it is a 15 drive out of the city core. If you decide to drive parking is free but can be a bit of an issue. It is often full.

Biggest mall in Chiang Rai.  Similar to most Central Plazas around the country, but perhaps smaller. Great place to shop and find big city items. Top store had a great choice of imported foods, better than in most cites in Thailand. As with any Thai mall, parking is a challenge on weekends.

You could get a panoramic view of the Victoria Harbour dazzled with the towering and mountainous backdrop of Kowloon. It is always crowded with tourists all day, especially during the day, so do come over at nightfall for a better view around here. Also, do note that you could experience the light show which sets the Harbour ablaze every night starting from 8 pm, and I could tell you that it's really worth the wait to witness such spectacle here in the heart of Hong Kong!
The harbour view is great and the monument shows details of the gift PRC had given to HK in 1997 during the handover. Great place
One of the famous viewpoints with many visitors all the time, especially those who come from mainland. This views is mainly in honor of the return of Hong Kong back to China.
The perfect spot to watch the "Symphony of Lights" display each evening at 8:00pm.
Very nice little square by the harbour. Good surroundings like the anime character casts, but just be wary of times for visits. Huge tour parties can turn up at times and it can get quite crowded.

Top class library, with well adequate toilet and free water fountain. Can not take photos inside. Very well organized book racks, second story is for children education. Others are fiction, literature, art and others
Top class library. Largest library in Hong Kong. Very well thought-out layout. Well managed. Suitably located. With adequate facilities (toilet, water fountain).
I went to the library on Sunday just after the 春節. The study corner was likely occupied by the teens and students and its sometimes nice to just sit seeing them
Wonderful and contains many books. Quite suitable for kids.

The circulation of the building needs to improve, it is quite time consuming to wait for the lifts. Eight floor and above is kind of disconnected from the rest of the floors. I like the space at the silents reading area at the Top floor, mainly for art, magazine and architecture related material. The views outside is relaxing but I think that the space is too open to the interior, will cause some distraction and disturbance by the surroundings.

I went there for a music festival to see my idol and the environment was really pleasant. it has nice architecture and environment and I love the experience I had there. a very nice place to go for a concert.

A world class exhibition center. Access can be an issue. Taxi is best if you are not staying in a neighboring hotel such as Renaissance or the Grand Hyatt. Taxis can be slowed by the traffic, so be well planned!

Big centre with shopping. If you search on the map, it shows different direction and very long way. Actually it is very near to wan chai metro station. Walkable distance. Just follow the sign boards rather than Google map .

Every year I visit there for Film Market. It's near from Wanchai station. The center has two luxurious hotels `Hyatt' and `Renaissance' . You can go to the  restaurants in the other buildings via the connecting bridges.
Great place to spend a day there. Shopping seeing exhibition dinning just everything you need.

Interesting outdoor trails, architecture and wartime weapons. indoor exhibition is informative.
It’s currently closed for maintenance- check their website for updates before planning your trip

An excellent museum in Hong Kong for those in search of its colonial past. The exhibits are highly informative and have great views across the harbour on a clear day! Avoid when rainy though, as many displays are also outdoors!

Museum was very well maintained and staffed. Exhibits were very clear in Chinese and English but there were little to no interactive activities. It's great for those that like to read and learn, for those complaining about a lack of things to play with, they're better off going to Disneyland. Some well preserved equipment from different eras, and best of all, it's peaceful and quiet and FREE.
This museum is closed - not clear on website - wasted journey
It's closed until 2020. Change the opening hours so other people don't waste their time like I did.

Its a wonderful park with something for everyone. It has a great children's playground, with everything you would expect, with swings, sliders...sand pits, climbing frames and more challenging things for bigger kids...there is a skateboard park, and a duck pond. There are gardens full of flowers to enjoy, tennis,bowls and golf, put and play and crazy golf..tea shops toilets and ice cream and a bandstand

Probably the most amazing free outdoor children’s park I’ve ever been to. The range of equipment is vast! Several wonderful jungle gyms, with slides varying from beginners level all the way to this humongous tunnel slide which actually I’d quite like to get on myself!! 

With sandpits and climbing walls, a zip wire and so many swings, two double swings (for two children or an adult and a little one) one fully backed swing, lots of regular ones and even two of those big circle rope ones. 

There is also a cafe with toilets attached however I believe there is a charge for these so bring change.

There is also a nice ratio of sunny to shaded areas.

I’d happily bring the children here one morning with picnic blankets and food and spend the whole day !!

We had very nice time walking around the park. It's big, it's beautiful and have a lot of space for activities. Just take your blanket and picnic basket and head to Victoria Park for a lovely day :)
And Botanical Garden next to it is just magical. Perfect place to spend a day enjoying great weather, beautiful area and walking.

Lovely park for a wall and some fresh air. 
Had a picnic by the duck  pond, with my baby. Lots of ducks for children to feed. Lovely and clean, no litter anywhere,  lots  of benches to sit on.
We never went in the park, as my baby is only 11 weeks, but in time, we will. 
We'll  be back
Fabulous park, something for everyone. Family friendly play area which has a huge range of play equipment for all ages. Also love the botanic gardens and big open spaces for picnics
A park that proved great for a morning walk. Great place to catch the elderly doing their morning tai chi.

This is a park in the middle of the Hong Kong  most busiest area. But, you can find the peace and slience inside.  People like to walk and jogging during the lunch hour. Some people also like to bring their takeout and enjoy the sunshine. During the busy day, it is a good place to ponder for next half day. After a day, you can also go for a relax.
Good park. Enough place to walk around and a really good football pitch.
A real oasis in bustling Quarry Bay to stretch your legs, watch football or just take a breath of fresh air.
Very peaceful promenade, many ppl take a walk after lunch or dinner.
Great little course. Quiet day at the races and had some great fun. Would do it again.

Lovely race course for the smaller meeting so I wish I could give two reviews but can't .They struggle with bigger events they have a silly buy tickets to get drinks system where you decide in advance how many drinks you want and queue to buy non refundable drink tickets. Then you take your tickets and queue at the bar again ,to buy a drink with your tickets firstly the buyer stands there and counts there tickets carefully then the barperson carefully counts the tickets meanwhile everyone is waiting .If this is designed to prevent queueing they need to rethink it and while your waiting you are missing and the action you miss racers or miss getting a bet on or miss using your tickets that are non refundable it's a shame because it is a great course when not busy they need a better system others do it much better
Love this track. Awesome venue for a cup day lunch.
Great venue, very kid friendly and very relaxed environment.
Awesome facilities great atmosphere had the best day for Melbourne cup 🐎🐴🍺👍

It's a great place where surrounded in hustle and bustle.
The environment is comfortable and spacious.  Tired their seafood baked rice which is great.  Service is ok, but can be improved.  And they have power plug and cables for your phone charging, not even busy even for lunch
Excellent Americano. Much better than S* and P*. Friendly staff with nice and cozy environment.

This shop on G/F of 39 Yiu Wah Street, is the only remaining shop of Caffe Kenon.  One of the favorite places for Latte Macchiato.  Large window viewing the busy street of the Canal road.  The entrance is on Canal road, not Yiu Wah Street.
Cheap and yummy breakfast
quick good service, small cosy and private spaces, They could do special request like NO PORK? ☺
The food was delicious. I'm happy I found a vegan place to go in Daejeon. They even sell other vegan items like detergent, chocolate bars, soap and soy protein. Will definitely go back!
Friendly owner who speaks English well:) The food is great too!
Ok
모든재료와 식감이  만점 주고 싶네요.   맛과  영양을  생각한 국산 재료와  식감이  대박입니다.

음식은 좋습니다
주인장이 불친절합니다

Good local HK style breakfast with macaroni and instant noodles in tomato/chicken soup, with various combination such as luncheon meat, beef slice, ham etc. Also a selection of western fares such as pancakes and sussages. 

The Japanese Style omelette is quite good. Toast is thick and soft. 

The coffee and teas are quite nice.

One of the few shops that opens up early.

Not what I was expecting. I was expecting a real Hong Kong cafe, but that was my-bad for not looking thoroughly at the pictures. They do have coffee and milk teas, but not the legit Hong-Kong-kind I was searching for. 

This cafe is located in a mall on the 3rd floor? The waitress was hasty, but also efficient. She did not really want to make suggestions or had time to. Must be ready to order or she walks away to do other things. 

PROS: opened early. most establishments are still closed for breakfast around 8am.
食物還可以，環境太逼

Peking Garden used to very very good and was toted to be a premium restaurant, at least along the Maxim's Group chain, but it didn't strike me as anything special. Returning on a Sunday evening at 6pm, service was already bustling and busy. The menu, while long, didn't seem to have a wide variety of options. Two Peking ducks were ordered in advance. A little disappointed in their selection of noodles and non-pork friendly dishes. There was only one fried noodle dish and the rest were all soup noodles. Thankfully the removed the pork and substituted with mushrooms. Overall, the food tasted OK, would probably be able to find better Peking duck elsewhere.

Service not too polite. Peking duck is nothing compared with real one in Beijing. Even a local restaurant in Beijing has better one.

The skin has too much meat and not crispy. The bread wrap for Peking duck is too thick and smell bad

Forgot to say that the Peking duck can be cooked in one way or 3 ways. The other 2 ways are optional. We only ordered one way. Make sure you can bring the remain of the duck to take out. The servers will not ask u. The remain of the duck is big. In fact, the 1 way cooking consumed less than 1/2 of the duck.
The lunch set is cheap and delicious,  the roasted duck is the best!

Semi-buzy restaurant in City Plaza mall. The personnel were not very attentive but seemed be quite routinized with their work. The menu was ok, mostly consisting of fusion of dim sum and Beijing style Chinese food. Beijing duck was average and the presentation of the dish was poor. Dim sum was ok. Not too expensive place. Clean toilets.
This is a very nice chinese restaurant. The Peking duck is a signature. The seating is also comfortable.

Great food and open  24 hours!  I love them because they have a huge range of breakfast options with a lot of combinations possible so anybody can find something to eat! On top of that they serve a bottomless coffee pot so you can have as much as you want. Restaurant and restroom are clean and the staff is nice and can speak very good English

Always sure of a hearty breakfast at Flying Pans in HK. Healthy options as well as full on 'giant breakfasts'. One of my favourites English Breakfast places. They do a v good vegetarian breakfast too. Ok for kids  5 yrs ++ as well. Family oriented. DO Give it a try. I'll be back again soon. THANKS.

Food is ok, but portions are surprisingly large. It would be great if they could add calorie values to their items.

Simple scrambled eggs seem to be more than enough. The omelettes and frittatas were a bit too oily and heavy.

There is a nice selection of side dishes to choose from, but there is no opt out option.

The set drinks, all juices, are tiny in comparison to the food portions and take quite some value away from the sets.

Sets come also with different choices of bread, which come buttered already. That was a surprise,  especially if you are looking to cut some calories. Also, you get several slices, way more than one would normally eat.

I would patronize this place only occasionally, as there are better tasting, and healthier options available nearby.

I reviewed this place some time back and gave it 5 stars, this was our regular spot for breakfast on weekends. Unfortunately, on our recent visits the staff became quite rude. On my previous visit I ordered bottomless coffee and gave a sip to my girlfriend from my own cup, the staff charged us for two coffees stating both of us were drinking it, even though my girlfriend had her own bottomless tea... aside if this inside there were a few other mix ups , not sure I’m coming back ...
Decent diner style place with friendly staff. If you crave American style breakfast it's a good place to visit, open 24h. Eggs Benedict are delicious. Drinks could be a little larger.

车仔面is a dish I couldn't appreciate, you get to choose whatever ingredients you like in their vast menu and the stall would just mixed them into the soup noodle and served to you. Some of the items are deep fried which though are only freshly fry upon order, they are immediately thrown into the soup noodle which ended up causing the soup to be overly oily and the fried item would lost all its crispiness. Even though some of the ingredients are deliciously done but collectively the whole dish seems like a idea created because of a vast leftover.
Not bad fresh and tasty Hong Kong cart noodle
Cheap, go-to local noodle store in Tin Hau. Most budget meal option around the area. Chinese only.

Excellent services
Yummy noodles
Very good  ！！！
Good affordable food, late at night.
The food was excellent.   Very fresh and flavorful.   Accommodating staff.  All good!
Pho is good! The real star here is the banh mi; probably one of the best ones I’ve ever had!

Stopped in to get some Pho to take home, this place is charming.  The folks here are warm, welcoming and very helpful. The menu is very nice with some  very good looking Vietnamese offerings. The Pho was delicious, exceptionally fragrant and tasty.  This is definitely on my list of places to come back to.
This place is great if you have never been to a Vietnamese restaurant before. Otherwise it's pretty average quality food at prices where I'd expect better. Hit or miss on the service.

They have a full menu, but just soup, but the soup is excellent. A huge bowl of delectable broth, thin sliced beef, noodles (egg or rice), sprouts, fresh greens (mint, cilantro, basil and others) fresh jalapeño slices, and fresh lime.
Chinese seafood restaurant. Reasonable prices for quality cooking. Long time customers usually. Better make reservations, always fully booked at dinner.

This is one of my favorite Cantonese dim-sum restaurants in Hong Kong. The place is clean and comfortable. Quality of the food is very good and everything is scrumptious. Apart from the dim-sum, their fried rice and noodles are also very tasty. I recommend the yin-yang rice particularly.
Great Food n Din Sum here. Avg. waiting time is 30-45 mins
A very busy Dim Sum Restaurant that offers discount to customers who settle their bills before 12:30pm (Mon - Sat) or before 12 noon (Sun and holidays). Food is tasty and service is friendly.
Bad cuz there is insects in food and mice found on the floor either dead or alive

It's a nice shopping mall, with a view of the surrounding harbor; it has a food court with plenty of options and a several-story parking lot. You can get there by car or by public transport (well organized by the way, I recommend the day ticket if you're a frequent traveller). One of the ships the Queen used is there, decommissioned and attached to the mall; you can visit it for a fee.

It is a huge place filled with different stores, they all have different closing times as well so you better get there soon. There are also stores for almost all occasions ranging from tech to clothing. Although there is no reception signal or internet, it is still a great place to go and shop at
Great place for a day out shopping and eating!!  Great choices for food.  Transgression Park inside and free car park so handy for kids and family.
A good shopping centre and unusually these days most of the units inside have been taken up. Car parking though at either end of the shopping area is very tight.
Great range of shops and facility's. Good parking and transport links. And not far out from Edinburgh Centre.

This is one of the sacred temples that Hong Kong people go at least every year if they are either Buddhist or Taoist. There are a lot of tourists every day. People who worship and pay their respects may find their wishes granted according to people who go there. This is one of the reasons you find many devoted believers praying outside the temple. It is also for tourists to appreciate this temple is part of Hong Kong heritage and culture. It is a must itinerary for many visitors who first visit Hong Kong 😊

This temple seems to be very sacred and important to local residents and Chinese people. I'd a brief visit to this temple. The place is enormously crowded with lots of people heading to the main temple for burning incenses and make offerings. We can buy incenses and other offerings materials from the stalls around the temple. After that we've to move towards the temple in line, light up the incenses on the way and finally offer in front of the temple. While moving in line we have to be extra cautious about getting burned by the lighted incenses because almost all people light up their incenses while proceeding to the main offering site. Getting inside the main temple is restricted and saw merely few can enter inside the temple. A great temple to make offerings and receive blessings. After visiting this temple, you all can enjoy shopping or find something to eat at the Temple-mall which is just next to this temple.

Don't know when it was built / established but knew it from older generations.
To locals it is a place that they usual visit twice a year, firstly, to pray for their wishes, usually in respect of their family, career, peace, marriage and all other kinds of hopes. By the end of the year they should comeback to thanks for the assistance given by the Gods of the temple in return. 
To tourists, it is a historical built place that worth visiting.

Beautiful temple with deep Taoist traditions, famous for being a good place to have prayers answered. Great spot for tourists to get souvenirs (bracelets, malas, charms, amulets), then find something to eat nearby or do some shopping at the mall.

Built with Feng Shui elements this temple located amidst the high-rises is considered religious and is frequented both by the locals as well as tourists.
Maintained immaculately clean the foyer before the temple has big statues. There are shops selling incense sticks and other offerings. A big shallow bowl kept in front of the temple entrance is for sticking the incense sticks.
A cool and silent ambience multiples the prayer and peace.

Extremely affecting experience that was totally unique. When they say 'dark', they truly mean pitch black. Never experienced that kind of total darkness before and it was pretty terrifying for someone with claustrophobia. Still well worth it for the challenge, sensory experiences and good lesson.

Easy to find, excellent directions on the website. Well arranged and prepared. You are guided through a variety of experiences in complete darkness for 75 minutes. It was very moving and I would recommend it to everyone. Don't miss this chance. It's great for children too.
Had a great time. Brings great awareness to the society with sight disability.
Really interesting experience and the guide was very welcoming and friendly!

Great experience in a pitch black environment. Very cool the fact they can imitate in such a smaller indoor space the everyday things we encounter, except we don't see them anymore and only left with our other senses.
Great museum to explore to see the creativity and work of art -- specifically the calligraphy!
A good museum to go to.  Has a variety of fantastic pieces of art work.  Very creative and imaginative.
Great art museum and central to Hong Kong culture. Currently closed for extensive Renovations and will be a great experience when it opens next year

The Hong Kong Museum of Art is the main art museum of Hong Kong. It is managed by the Leisure and Cultural Services Department of the Hong Kong Government. A branch museum, the Flagstaff House Museum of Tea Ware, is situated in the Hong Kong Park.

The Hong Kong Museum of Art closed in 2015 for an extensive, multi-year renovation. It is scheduled to reopen in 2019.

The museum changes its displays regularly. The exhibitions in the museum are mainly of paintings, calligraphy and sculpture from Hong Kong, China and other parts of the world. It has cooperated with other museums as well.

This is a really good museum as it has some pieces missing from Beijing and Taipei's collections.   There are a lot of good historical pieces.  

My favorite is the 千字文.  A poem written with a thousand different words.   It makes for a great piece when learning Chinese.

Excellent place to expand young minds. My 1.5 year old absolutely loved the children’s learning area and was fascinated by all other exhibits. This museum is very well run, clean and staffed with very friendly workers. Compared to science and children’s museums from NYC and New Orleans - this one takes the cake. It’s also free on Wednesdays but be forewarned that the entire Hong Kong school system will also visit with you during that time. Lovely place that I return to religiously during my visits to Asia. Highly recommended.

The museum is so much fun for kids. There is so much for them to interact with. Too many to list but the electricity exhibits were great, the DNA real length cord was fun and even I was surprised kangaroo DNA is longer than human. The nature section is a lot of fun. Of course the huge dinosaur me related exhibits are great. There's a cool optic exhibition with crazy mirrors. The permanent exhibition is super good value. The temporary exhibitions can be great but often there's a line. Finally this is a great place to escape the heat when you're with kids. The air con is perfect.

A very educational museum for kids, adults and the STEM lovers. Quite a lot of things for kids to try out - science experiment demonstration workshops, storytelling session. The kid zone is the best as they got a engineering zone for kids to play as builders and engage them with digging bricks, carrying bricks by trolleys, transferring via the circulation tracks. It's overall an awesome area for a fun day out indoors. Highly recommended for family with kids, especially it's free of charge for kids below the age of 14.
Seek for knowledge, explore something you do not know, uncover some interesting from ordinary... Good to see, and great to experience ヽ(・∀・)ゝ

One of a kind interactive exhibition with different areas for certain topics and issues of the past and especially future engaging the bodies and the brains of young and old visitors in exploring the "forces" of our world and thereby teaching us. It is certainly too large for one visit but not expensive as children go free and worth every penny and minute visiting.

Great museum for people who are interested in learning the truth and honoring those who died for freedom. This museum is quite affordable so you have no reason not to go. I highly recommend it. Never forget the tank man.
Small and very few exhibits on display. All explanations are provided in Chinese - those who does not read Chinese would probably not enjoy it. Staff are friendly and helpful.
This place is very informative of 6489. I was glad to visit, and got great pics. Staff were also very helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable as well. God Bless 6489 Museum.
Informative, staff are helpful and really willing to introduce the history of 8964, display with different kinds of presentation method, worth to visit and to have a better understanding for 8964
A valuable and meaningful museum which contains true and full records of June 4th 1989 and stimulate to think about human rights.

Free historical site. Must go if you would like to learn more about the history of this place and how Kowloon walled city began in its early days to the teardown of the walled city. There are many detailed explanations and also audio/visual introduction of the walled city. Wasn't that crowded, with a mixture of locals and tourists. Overall a nice and scenic place.

Visiting this historical site was just the best ever. Don’t have the words to express my astonishment. After all the videos I’ve seen and pictures I browsed, looking at this park with my own eyes WOW that’s all I need.
Beautiful and relaxing park.. The twirled of the birds are music to my ears.. The water fall  from the wall is lovely and amazing.
A beautiful gardens full of wonderful trees flowers and so peaceful. There were folk doing Tai Chi in quiet corners. Lovely buildings a waterfall and sculptures. Well worth a visit.

Nice park. Not much is remaining from the walled city. Exhibitions are a tad lame as well. Park itself is really wonderful thought. Do not come expecting history, just for a relaxing walk with some mildly interesting points on the way.

This place is definitely worth a visit if you are adventurous! It’s like a labyrinth inside..... with vendors of phones money changers etc etc...... also a great selection of Indian restaurants to be found. Try to avid the touts at the entrance..... just take stairs or lift and you will find plenty of them ! I have tried a few now all good decent Indian or Nepalese fare. Good prices. Also barber on first floor is great !

Amazing location, lots of good food in the area and stalls downstairs. Elevator may take a while but definitely not as long as some people make it out to be. Definitely safe unlike mentioned online with police patrolling and plenty of people. Stayed in block A and room was a pleasant surprise too.

Be prepared for tiny rooms and beds, noisy environment, paying cash for your accommodation (even if you booked with a credit card) and waiting in a line for the elevators.

If you are 190 cm or taller, consider another options or at least try to ensure a large bed. 

The only good thing about this building is the convenient location. The prices should be low as well, but that depends on the time of the year - for example during the Christmas and New Year holidays you will have to pay more.

Shocked to see so many reviews here as well as a 3.5 rating... went into the Chungking Mansions thinking it was something else. Indian guys wouldn't stop pestering us about their rooms and we even specified that we weren't looking for one as we already had a hotel room elsewhere. It was disgusting in there and smelled like @$**. Wouldn't eat there either.  Shady place in every aspect.
Not really scared when I walked in to the Mansions, there are many cheap and KH style hostels on the high floor, if you are backpacker, here is the best choice.
OK
OK
Good
試過兩次漏單,等咗半個鐘，原來兩次都跑夜馬..
地方唔錯，冷氣夠凍，乾淨，服務態度可以。兩個人食左116蚊，一個菜遠牛河，一杯熱奶茶，一個常餐，味道可以啊。

Be prepared to test your bargaining skills! Or even better, act like you’re prepared to walk away! And you can’t feel guilty about it! :) Such a fun place to look around and to get gifts and gadgets! Take your time to look around as a few stalls do sell the same things. Not a fan of the fake stuff being sold but if it’s your thing, you’d have a field day! Super easy to get to with public transport and with lots of surrounding places to grab a bite too! Would recommend this for the experience!
They close early , around 21:00 because they do local people business, even the prices are better than ladies street
Local shopping area in fashion, fruit, food and household.
Great place for clothes shopping..street sife stores better than market stalls

There's lots of great stuff to buy. You'll love it here. Don't forget to haggle. Try to haggle as low as 50% the price of the item. Sometimes,  you can even go lower. You can get souvenir items here, as well as gadgets. But if you want original items, you can visit stores nearby. Walk around and you will see the shops of Adidas, Vans, Nike, and many more. You'll also love the street food! You should try the octopus on sticks!

Wonderful experience. Lovely staff, food was great. Traditional Chinese food, ordering was simplified for us English-speaking customers. Portions were great and the atmosphere was welcoming. Thoroughly recommended!

Must stop for anyone visiting Hong Kong.  All you can eat food + beer is ridiculously cheap for the value.  The place is also BYOB, so bring along something nicer for yourself.  Don't forget card/dice for drinking games!   

The crowd sometimes can get onto the sidewalk but the host will almost certainly try his best to make sure everyone gets seated.  You may even get a free bottle of wine on a lucky day.  This is truly an authentic local experience from a tourist's perspective.

So if your a white Westerner and they offer you a set meal, expect it to be tasteless and too much food. It was not good. For 180HK we got LOADS of beer and loads of food. There's a chance the actual Chinese food they cook is good but I would not know. Probably a great place to drink in the evenings though! Staff were really nice they just dumb down the food for white people. 3 stars are for the amount of beer and nice people though!

Good place to be on a Friday/Saturday night. Very cheap all you can eat food and beer for only 80hkd. Limited seating. Lots of exchange students/tourists. To be honest the food is probably a 1/5 but the experience is why you should come here. Mr Wong is also a Trump supporter so if you get triggered by Trump posters, you might want to stay away although I think he is just trolling.
Very good food and good price. 80$ for a lot of beers and food! I was not able to finish my plates even if it was very tasty. People were nice. I spent a good moment :)

Great tasting dim-sum at bargain prices. Good selection of about 20 dishes, including all the favourites! This branch only has the Michelin Bib Gourmand so if you're looking for the starred branch you'll need to queue elsewhere. Very typical service for a dim-sum place so don't expect much! Cash only for paying the bill!
Great food, excellent service. Price... Very cheap. The baked pork buns are exceptional. So light and sweet. The fresh steamed shrimp dumplings were lovely. Whole shrimp. Yum
Pretty standard - I ended up preferring Dim Dim Sums dimsum offerings. Not really sure what the hype is around,  but it isn't bad food at all. Fairly good and at a low price point too.

the food is above average but not mind blowingly good. Their roast pork bun is definitely excellent and this is a must try but the other dishes were not very impressive. However, it is very cheap to eat here! So all things considered it’s got a very good value proposition. However, the service is absolutely abysmal.
No, don’t go there. I thought it was the same everyone was talking about, but we were slightly disappointed. There are places I  tried better dumplings.

Don't let the shabby mall deter you, the food here is incredible. Super flavorful and everything is made very well. Not very upscale environment, so it's nice just for friends to get lunch but I wouldn't bring a date here. Very well could be the best Indian food I've ever had.

As curry nuts, we were really looking forward to visiting this place, and we weren't disappointed. We revisited a couple of times to try different things. It's obviously vegetarian, but tell one of the staff you're vegan and they'll grab one of the experienced waiters, who will know exactly what you can choose from the menu and what can be adapted. Two of our guests don't like too much heat, but with help from the waiter, we had no problem finding milder dishes. Highly recommended for authentic Indian cuisine.

Found this incredible south indian food at Hong kong. Friendly staff. 

Ambience.   4/5
Food.           4/5
Staff.            Quick and efficient
Enjoyed the food. 8 of us visited and all liked the dishes. It was quick and good service. Those who miss Indian food in HK, it's a place to go.
Best Cauliflower Masala Dosan in Hong Kong, and the Samosas were excellent! Affordable Indian vegetarian restaurant in TST. Will return.😊
Very nice place. I like to spend my evenings there. A good selection of wine and light but very bright salads. Especially the seafood is good. The situation has, contingent happy.

Excellent and authentic Cantonese food with attentive service. Waiter observed that we were hesitant to order tea (though they have good selection of tea shown at the front reception) because it was dinner time. So he suggested chrysanthemum tea which contains no caffeine. Very good charcoal grilled char siu tho on the pricey side. Some famous Chinese people dine here frequently. Good for VIP-spotting too.

Yat Tung Heen is a cheaper option (by about 30%) with better quality dim sum and service than City Hall.   They do not have trollies being pushed around the restaurant, so that would be the one draw back.  That said, on the weekend, getting a table is easy, the server visits regularly, and the food is served warm and fast.  The dim sum menu is in English and Chinese with about 40-50 options plus veggie and rice sides.  

If you need an easy place on the weekend with no hassle, I would highly recommend Yat Tung Heen.

The best restaurant I had a pleasure of visiting while in Hong Kong. A big group of us went and shared a round table. We were able to try most of their dishes and everything was delicious. Loved that all the plates were placed on a revolving table.
A nice place to have yum cha or lunch in Wanchai in terms of service, food quality and space.

Awesome that a place like this exists. The beyond meat burger was great. Texture similar to meat, made of pea protein, endorsed by Leonardo DiCaprio! 

Restaurant is in the mall section where all the kids clothes are. Ground floor. If you enter via canton rd to need to walk about 5 mins to another section of the mall. You cross over on level 2 around Chanel and Louis vuitton

Deceptive about their closing times. Please put your "last order" as your closing time. You're not the first Hong Kong restaurant to deceive people and to make people go all the way to your store only to find out that it's "last order".

I had ‘future hotdog’ & fries tonight.
Future hotdog is very small and taste so-so , it’s really over priced! Fries are crispy & much better than hotdog!

I wouldn't go back if I have other vegi choose around.

If healthy eating, animal free meal choices and environmentally conscious products was the question... Green Common has the answer!

A simply impeccable example of a cafe/restaurant/grocers in 2018 providing what a picture of the future could look like.

With menus based on big name vegan products such as “Impossible Meats,” “Dairya” and many others, this spot is my number one choice when visiting Hong Kong for both Eat In, Takeaway as well as Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner.

Excellent.

It strikes me as a restaurant whose main mission is to promote the vegan products they  sell at the adjacent store. Still, it is a creative restaurant that offers interesting vegan food mimicking meat dishes. I think their menu can be less dependent on the items sold at Green Common like Beyond burgers, Beyond Meat or Just Egg. The problem is, I have lost interest in going there again after sampling their dishes once,  as the sense of novelty vanished.

Crab cake and seasonal dry aged rib eye steak are made to perfection. However the porterhouse steak was not as amazing in comparison. If you are looking for juicy, strong flavour of beef and tender meat, dry aged rib eye is definitely the wise choice. Overall portion is quite big, especially for the sides.
Never disappointing. Personable staff remember my name. Food prepared to perfection. Monthly special menus keep things interesting with excellent seasonal offerings.

I love the sliders at this place! It's perfect as a quick snack. The bun is so fresh and delicious and the meat is cooked to perfection! 

The service is professional and welcoming.

Morton's has grown to over 74 restaurants, but the vision is the same today as it was when we opened our first restaurant in Chicago in 1978. Quality. Consistency. Genuine Hospitality. Prime Beef at Morton's is aged for 23-28 days is so  delicious.
crab cake  is also a yummy dish.
Probably the best steakhouse in town! Well choices of steak cut and cooked very well! Food other than steak is a bit salty though
Very good Japanese restaurant. Great food and loads of options, all very tasty.

This little place is hard to beat. The chirashi sushi lunch set was a generous portion, high in quality, including the rice, and very fair in price.  The side dishes were equally good.  The service was prompt and friendly. I will be back to try some of their other dishes.
Food Fresh and People friendly
Great food. Slightly pricey
Great quality of menu, excellent service. Highly Recommended.

Due to a mix up on my part with my landlord my water was shut off yesterday due to the land lord ending service. As a pet owner with two large dogs and a cat as well as a roommate I needed the water back on quickly. I went in, signed up and explained the situation and within 3 hours my water was back on. I realize this is definitely not the norm as far as turnaround time and truly appreciate the extra mile these folks went to help me.

While I do understand that sometimes water outages happen, my whole neighborhood has been without water over 17 hours (and counting!) with no explanation and no update as to how long it would take to fix.  There was no natural disaster or major reason why our water should be out this long.  Living without water in your house is a major deal and some update should be given to customers.  I asked to speak to the manager after I got no update from the customer service rep, but she said that because I wasn't the primary account holder (I rent), I wasn't able to.  So that's why I'm leaving a review.  Aqua Texas, you really need to change your policies and better serve your customers.

I had three of their pipes deteriorate and leak in my backyard. I had to spend several hours waiting for the contractors they hired to come and repair the pipes all three times and they left my yard lob sided from the dirt they didn't level.

I called Aqua regarding a water leak on their main, near my neighbors house. I first noticed the leak almost four months ago. I finally caught the neighbor at home about two months ago and they said it had been reported. Aqua sent someone out to paint a blue mark indicating where the leak is at. This leak is still ongoing, possibly contaminating the community water supply. The response from the Aqua emergency phone number was "Sir, you'll have to call back Monday after 9:00". Called back only to hear them say there was no report of a leak at the address, and there was no such address on Lakeridge  Loop. Tried to help this neighbor, but sorry, they're on their own now. It may get fixed after a meter reader falls through a sink hole caused by the leak.
If I could give them zero stars, I would. I was on hold for a supervisor for over 20 minutes and still never spoke to one. Worst customer service!

Beautiful experience! It's smaller than Disneyland but so cool. Haunted Mansion is replaced by a different Mansion! Go if you get the chance. It's less expensive and the Disney train that takes you to the park entrance is so plush and adorable!!

It was a fun experience, especially for children. Sadly, when we went in March 2019, the Sleeping Beauty castle has not reopened. The Ant Man and the Wasp experience has not opened either. But I will encourage you to stay for the Night Parade, which is way better than the Day Parade. If available, also watch the Festival of the Lion King. It was very good! The Iron Man experience was also enjoyable and funny.

I'd read that it's a lot smaller than others Disney's, but I was not disappointed at all with the size. It was very easy to get to on the train from Hong Kong Island. The castle was unfortunately under renovation when we visited and there was no evening parade or fireworks as we've experienced at other Disney's. The rides were great though and we had a fantastic time.
Our visit was great! The people there were very nice. You can try asking the staff there for stickers as I was able to collect quite a few and they were very cute!

Me and my family love the place. Lots of rides,attractions, shops, cafes. Don't have to wait long for your turn for the rides. 2 cafes served halal foods. Love the Iron Man ride and the Ant Man new ride. We didn't manage to get into the castle as it was under renovation. Love the afternoon parade as well. Energetic and super friendly performers with non-stop smiles on theirs faces. Will came back again in future.
Nice place to visit, gives peace of mind. You can relax yourself in lap of nature. Happy journey 😊

A must see for all tourists visiting the area. There are many things to view at the Monastery including a temple. 

It is beautiful and situated on top of the mountain. A very traditional experience that gives you insight into the culture here.

We visited Monastery won't while we were visiting the large Buddha on lantau Island. The monastery has many structures to look in and see the different related items. You're able to order food here that is vegan Chinese. There are some facilities but they may not me what you were used to as some of the toilets are basically a hole in the ground Style squat toilet.
Nice place to visit..... You reach there by cable Car which is an awesome experience... One can be with nature and the mountains around makes you feel pleasant happy.......
Fresh air..  Pleasing place..  Go and Relax..  Big Buddha have around 200 steps..  Try to avoid seniors there, they will enjoy the village..
Delicious mix of South African and Thai cuisine. Fresh ingredients, nice atmosphere, good service. Need to try reduce single use plastic.
This is a great location, but the food could use a bit of work. Lovely atmosphere and nice wait staff.
Best steak i had since landing on lantau. Excellent. Chef interested and proud of her work. It was lovely.
Great food and friendly staff!
Tried this only south African restaurant in Hong Kong. Comfortable environment, friendly staff and tasty food but with reasonable prices. Have tried their lunch sets and feel content.
As always, the apple crumble was fantastic.  We ordered two big trays to go for our 80-odd person retreat at the Methodist Retreat Centre.  Completely worth the excursion!
Nice view. Friendly staff. Cute dogs. Delicious food. Wonderful experience.
Delicious food, generous portions, great view and atmosphere, friendly staff.
Great venue, good food and a great spot for drinks in Mui Wo.

Food is delicious 
Dog so cute
And view is awesome

Terrible all round. Dont eat or drink anything here. Pies were terrible and old. Drinks were overpriced. And they charged me double what the price stated on the menu! Staff are rude and impatient. WILL NEVER COME BACK!!! PURE GARBAGE!!!

What a poor service - staff do not care about the order, they do not know what they are selling, the food taste and cooking were out of standards and in addition there is no indication a customer cannot buy to take away. Mr Delifrance wake up and keep your quality in this place!
Good food as always. Comfortable setting.

I only ordered an almond pastry and cold milk tea here.  The pastry was filled with almond paste.  It was really yummy.  The cold milk tea was very tasty as well.  This place has almost everything minus the kitchen sink.  U can buy sandwiches, pastries, cookies, teas, chips, pizzas, yogurt, burritos, candy and drinks.   If u r planning to catch a flight to the US, u will drink your drink quickly since u will need to pass a second security in which beverages are not allowed.  I wish I had known this b4 I had made the purchase.
Take a break in Delifrance for a Tea time

One of the best Pizza Huts in the area. First folks in so the buffet wasn’t completely out yet. Though the food that was, was absolutely delicious & hot. Staff was friendly & on top of things. Restaurant was pretty clean & well organized.
SO so ummy...and I love supporting young readers -- thanks, Hut! ...did I mention how very yummy the pizza was? Seriously. Good pizza 🥰
Love their pizza! It's the best anywhere. The service at this one is amazing, too!
Food was good and so was the service. Waitress was great also!
Pizza hut has been always the best pizza and love the salads and sauces. Great services as well.
Shopping mall and Hotel ( Novotel).  Very convenient, location, good restaurants also. Three is a train(subway) station, so you can easy get to airport o any other part of peninsula or island.

What a fantastic little hidden gem. The store is beautiful and the experience provided by the sales staff especially, Lana was fantastic. From the moment I walked in she was very welcoming and attentive. Her knowledge of the products and her advice was exceptional. She made the process of finding a style and colour to suit me very easy. She has wonderful customer service and I would highly recommend the store and Lana for the purchase of your next special gown.

Far from being an outlet.
Prices are high, old fashion, old collections. 
Don't waste your time here.
Great shopping mall to enjoy the restaurants around here and one thing to note is that there's a hotel here as well. This place is a good stopover since it is near the MTR (subway) station as well.

A seriously good collection of discounted brand names although I've come to realize these discounts are now nowhere near as good as they were 2-3 years ago. Who's kidding who? The influx of mainland Chinese on buying trips has caused a disproportionate rise in store prices. This is no longer a shoppers paradise like it was in 2013-2017!! I've bought may items here over the years from many different stores but I've found princess today are not as discounted from outside prices as the stores say they are. Greed has crept back in at Citygate. Local code shops and restaurants are still ok.
Relatively cheap in terms of buffet dinner in hotel. Good quality lamb rack and cold seafood. Hot food is fair. Dessert is ok. Environment is excellent.
Good selection but the taste is just average
Value for money. Food is middle range.  Hotel style environment.  Ideal family high tea over weekends.  Ample food supplies. Many choices.
Standard Hotel Buffet. Good variety. Chinese and Western. Banana Cake a highlight.

Variety of food is average, but quality is good. The sashimi and snow crab are fresh and succulent. Though the price is a little steep, I would still go if there are any promotional prices. Comparing to the food available at citygate, this is considered an indulgence.

Beautiful experience! It's smaller than Disneyland but so cool. Haunted Mansion is replaced by a different Mansion! Go if you get the chance. It's less expensive and the Disney train that takes you to the park entrance is so plush and adorable!!

The Iron Man experience was also enjoyable and funny.

The rides were great though and we had a fantastic time.
