Love the Iron Man ride and the Ant Man new ride. We didn't manage to get into the castle as it was under renovation. Love the afternoon parade as well. Energetic and super friendly performers with non-stop smiles on theirs faces. Will came back again in future.

The Murray House is the perfect spot for diners who want to enjoy the European flare of Stanley. Like the majority of Stanley's sites. this house is not an original Stanley construction. 

The old British colonial-style was first built in Central in 1844 at the current site of the Bank of China building, but disassembled in 1982, only to be reassembled in Stanley in 2001 in almost the exact same form. 

The dining inside takes things to an even more foreign level with high end Spanish German and Vietnamese restaurants serving up anything but local food.
Beautiful sea view here.
Hkd$288 11:30am ~ 2:30pm weekend semi brunch buffet

Excellent place to be in. Great ambience. The H&M anchor store is very nice. The view from the balcony is great too. One can catch up with some beer along with some breath taking view from the bar on the first level. Great place to be at during the Blue hour to capture some great shots.
Nice historical site. Murray House was a naval barrack relocated from Central to Stanley.
good
A beautiful temple looks quite new
Historical Tin Hau Temple.  It's got more deities than an average temple.  Worth a visit.
A nice and clean temple which is very close to the Stanley pier. There is a piece of tiger skin in the temple with a cool little back story, should definitely check it out
Nice temple. People pray here.
The best of the best.

Loved it! Unique destination dining. You take a free boat ride across the marina to this massive floating restaurant. It's quintessentially an oriental artistic and architectural masterpiece. Opulent, vibrant and absolutely huge! The food is fabulous.

Definitely a memory making dining experience!

The Jumbo is a must to take our travel companions. One of those iconic experiences. As always the food came in as high quality but with an eye watering bill. At least 30 percent is however for the atmosphere, so we came away satisfied.

Seafood was very fresh, noodles we ordered were a little sticky and dry. Roasted pork was great. Service was not bad too, like what you would expect in a Chinese restaurant. Was expensive which was also expected. You would have to take a free ferry ride to the restaurant which is kind of cool. Was not crowded when we got there. There is also a guy taking souvenir pictures for you and you can purchase the pictures if you like.

This a a great experience if you plan on visiting Hong Kong. The outside of the restaurant is quite picturesque. So please take a moment to take photos etc. The food is delicious, affordable and the service is fast. Customer service is good for the most part. The staff members hovered over us though. Almost like rushing us to hurry and eat because there are more customers waiting. The drinks are served in very small glasses and cups. The food is served for groups just like any usual Chinese restaurant. In addition, you need to make a reservation if you plan to dine there. The views of the harbor is great. We went in the evening so we got to enjoy the views in the evening and in the night. 

IMPORTANT POINT

You have to take the ferry to access the floating restaurant. The Jumbo restaurant offer a free ferry to the restaurant. However, depending on which station you arrive at it may be far from the Jumbo restaurant ferry and will have to pay for ferry access to the restaurant. So please call ahead and ask which station is closest to the ferry.
Expensive and underwhelming. The dining room was so noisy, I felt like I was in a high school cafeteria. Also didn't help the noise level that our table was next to a dish station.

Had my wedding reception there 6 years ago. Loved the place, atmosphere, and staff. Just been back for lunch and it's still as beautiful as ever. Great lunch (with kids in tow this time), friendly + experienced staff. =)
Came to join a friend's wedding, it is a romantic place!
Great service. Great food. Amazing views

They do a great Sunday semi buffet brunch (with live music) serving among others freshly shucked oysters, sashimi and foie gras. Classic decor, great view of the waters and just a few minutes walk to the beach
A very nice banquet location in Hong Kong Island.
Excellent proper pub with great view over bay. Ever changing choice of ales and great gins. Very friendly staff, good food and best place in Falmouth to watch  live sport
Great classic pub with great local food amazing food and comfy vibe. I'd highly recommend it.

We came here as part of o 25 strong group For dinner .we were all asked to arrive promptly as our pre ordered food would be served for 7pm sharp.Unfortunately not the case.the mains came out in twos and threes,some of us had finished eating before others had received theirs.!!
The food itself was Ok but have had better for the price!. Beer drinkers also beware ,the range of draft beers is light on well knowns .I tried a couple of pints of their real ales but wasn’t bowled over.After spending nearly £80 There I won’t be in a hurry to return,Need to do better.
Its got some good ales a unique outside sitting area with fantastic views

A very nice, traditional pub.
The view across the Penryn to Flushing and across the Carrick Roads is stunning, especially in the evening as the sun sets.

Delicious and healthy lunch. I loved it, full of veges and chicken in a rich curry, coconut milk sauce. Fabulous cinnamon iced tea. Gracious and friendly service. Fun atmosphere. Will be back again and again!

In a city with abundant good eating places, the Rainbow remains our hands down first choice year after year. Delicious choices for both vegetarians and meat eaters. Breakfast and lunch only and both menus sport excellent choices. Great friendly service, warm cozy brick building with charming interior (formerly a bank with the vault still visible).One of the best if not THE best patio in town. Love love love it.

I was told this was a  vegetarian spot, so wasn't stoked at first. Then I found out they are more than willing to add bacon to anything. Everything I had was incredible! I tried everyone else's food, and my Benedict was incredible! Their pumpkin something pancakes were to die for and made great French toast sticks the next morning. Can't wait to try more of their food!

I’ve loved this place for a long time and have been many many times. Recently however, I’ve taken a break since there is a lot of inconsistency with their food quality and playing, though service is almost always great! This is the reason for 4 stars instead of 5. 

I really want this to be my favorite breakfast restaurant in Fort Collins, perhaps if they can improve consistency this will happen. Either way, I highly recommend you give it a try if you haven’t!

This locally owned restaurant is what Fort Collins is all about! Amazing food. Great people. Excellent service. The outside patio is gorgeous-surrounded by trees and little vegetable gardens. I love it!
